title: Arthroscopic Knee Replacement Technique for Faster Recovery
summary: Minimally invasive arthroscopic knee replacement reduces post-surgery pain and shortens recovery time for osteoarthritis patients.
content:
# What Is Arthroscopic Knee Replacement?
Arthroscopic (minimally invasive) knee replacement uses small incisions with specialized instruments to reduce soft-tissue trauma and improve recovery.

## Why Surgeons Choose It
- Smaller wounds and less bleeding
- Lower post-operative pain, faster mobilization
- Shorter hospital stays and earlier rehab

## Who Benefits Most
People with **degenerative osteoarthritis** whose pain and stiffness persist despite medication, injections, and physiotherapy.

## Recovery Roadmap
1. **Days 1–3:** pain control, assisted walking, ROM 0–60°
2. **Week 1–2:** quads activation, ROM 0–90°
3. **Week 3–6:** strength + balance training, gait retraining
4. **Week 6+:** return to low-impact sports (cycling, swimming)

> **Tip:** A structured **physiotherapy plan** is as important as the procedure itself. Consistency beats intensity.

## Risks & Precautions
DVT, infection, stiffness, or implant malalignment are uncommon but possible. Follow anticoagulation, wound care, and rehab protocols closely.

title: Early Warning Signs of Stroke You Should Know
summary: The FAST rule is a simple way to recognize and act quickly when stroke symptoms appear.
content:
# Recognize Stroke Early with FAST
**Stroke is an emergency.** Fast action limits brain damage and disability.

## The FAST Rule
- **F – Face:** one side droops when smiling
- **A – Arms:** weakness or numbness in one arm
- **S – Speech:** slurred or strange speech
- **T – Time:** call emergency services **immediately**

## Additional Red Flags
- Sudden severe headache, different from usual
- Loss of vision or double vision
- Dizziness, imbalance, incoordination

## Prevention You Can Start Today
- Control **blood pressure**, **blood sugar**, **cholesterol**
- Quit **smoking**; moderate alcohol
- **Exercise** 150–300 minutes/week (moderate)
- Mediterranean-style diet; reduce salt and trans fats

> When in doubt, **treat as stroke** and call for help. Time is brain.

title: How to Eat to Reduce Acid Reflux
summary: A low-fat diet, smaller meals, and avoiding late-night snacks are key to controlling GERD effectively.
content:
# Diet Strategies for Acid Reflux (GERD)
Nutrition and habits are first-line tools that complement medication.

## Build Your Plate
- **Low-fat proteins:** fish, poultry, legumes
- **High-fiber sides:** oats, non-citrus fruit, vegetables
- **Smaller, more frequent meals**; chew thoroughly
- Stop eating **2–3 hours before bedtime**

## Identify and Limit Triggers
- Very **fatty**, **spicy**, or **fried** foods
- **Chocolate**, **peppermint**, **caffeine**, **alcohol**
- **Citrus** and **tomato** products (if symptomatic)

## Helpful Habits
- Elevate head of bed 10–15 cm
- Maintain healthy weight; avoid tight belts/clothes
- Keep a **symptom diary** to spot personal triggers

> Consistency over perfection—small daily changes add up.

title: How Much Exercise Is Enough for a Healthy Heart?
summary: The WHO recommends 150-300 minutes of moderate activity per week to lower heart disease risk.
content:
# Weekly Exercise Targets for Heart Health
Aim for **150–300 minutes of moderate** or **75–150 minutes of vigorous** aerobic activity per week, plus **2 days of muscle-strengthening**.

## What Counts
- **Moderate:** brisk walking, easy cycling, dancing, gardening
- **Vigorous:** running, fast cycling, HIIT, competitive sports

## Make It Practical
- 30 minutes/day × 5 days (moderate), or 25 minutes/day × 3 days (vigorous)
- Split into **3 × 10-minute** bouts on busy days
- Add **strength training** (legs, back, chest, core) 2 days/week

## Extra Benefits
Lower blood pressure, improved lipids, reduced inflammation, better weight control, mood and sleep gains.

> Start low, go slow—progress gradually to avoid injury and burnout.

title: Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis: Tips to Ease Symptoms
summary: Saline nasal rinses and air purifiers can help reduce sneezing and congestion during allergy season.
content:
# Simple Ways to Relieve Seasonal Allergies
Seasonal allergic rhinitis flares with pollen. Daily habits and smart treatments can reduce symptoms.

## Home & Lifestyle
- Use **HEPA air purifiers** in the bedroom
- Shower and change after outdoor exposure
- Close windows on **high-pollen** days

## Symptom Relief
- **Saline nasal irrigation** 1–2×/day
- Consider **intranasal corticosteroids** for congestion
- Non-drowsy **antihistamines** for sneezing/itchy nose

## When to See a Doctor
Persistent symptoms, recurrent sinusitis, or suspected asthma. Immunotherapy can help selected cases.

> Combine avoidance + rinses + meds for best results.

title: Back Pain from Sitting Too Long: 5 Effective Stretches
summary: Plank, bird-dog, and hip flexor stretches help strengthen the spine and relieve chronic lower back pain.
content:
# Five Stretches to Undo Your Chair
Long sitting stiffens hip flexors and weakens the posterior chain. These moves improve mobility and reduce pain.

## The Big Five
1. **Cat–Cow** (30–60s): mobilize the spine
2. **Child’s Pose** (45–90s): lengthen back chain
3. **Hip Flexor Stretch** (45–60s/side)
4. **Bird-Dog** (8–10 reps/side): core + spinal stability
5. **Glute Bridge** (10–15 reps): activate glutes/hamstrings

## How Often
- 1–2 rounds/day for desk workers
- Pair with **hourly micro-breaks** and an ergonomic setup

> Gentle daily practice beats occasional intense sessions.
